DataElement.preferredDefinition: A tumor at the original site of origin.:The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body._Stage when the tumor has originated in the same organ, and has not metastasized to it

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A tumor at the original site of origin.:The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor at the original site of origin.:The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.longName: Primary Neoplasm
Concepts.definition: A tumor at the original site of origin.

Concepts.longName: Neoplasm Stage
Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.

Property.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.longName: Neoplasm Stage
Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 9/28/10 Released for use in caTissue Suite version 1.1 and/or 1.2 per owners direction.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Stage when the tumor has originated in the same organ, and has not metastasized to it

PermissibleValues.value: pT3b - Tumor grossly extends into renal vein or its segmental branches or vena cava below diaphragm

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Kidney cancer with tumor grossly extending into the renal vein or its segmental (muscle-containing) branches, or vena cava below the diaphragm. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer pT3b TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer with tumor grossly extending into the renal vein or its segmental (muscle-containing) branches, or vena cava below the diaphragm. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pT3a - Tumor directly invades adrenal gland or perirenal and/or renal sinus fat but not beyond Gerota's Fascia

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Kidney cancer with tumor directly invading the adrenal gland or perirenal and/or renal sinus fat, but not beyond Gerota's fascia. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer pT3a TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer with tumor directly invading the adrenal gland or perirenal and/or renal sinus fat, but not beyond Gerota's fascia. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pT3 - Tumor extends into major veins or invades adrenal gland or perinephric tissues

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Kidney cancer with tumor extending into major veins or invading the adrenal gland or perinephric tissues, but not extending beyond Gerota's fascia. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer with tumor extending into major veins or invading the adrenal gland or perinephric tissues, but not extending beyond Gerota's fascia. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pT2 - Tumor more than 7cm and limited to kidney

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Kidney cancer with tumor size more than 7 centimeters in greatest dimension, and limited to the kidney. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer with tumor more than 7 cm in greatest dimension, limited to the kidney. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.value: pT1b - Tumor more than 4cm and less than 7cm and limited to kidney

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Kidney cancer with tumor size more than 4 centimeters, but not more than 7 centimeters, in greatest dimension, and limited to the kidney. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer pT1b TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer with tumor more than 4 cm but not more than 7 cm in greatest dimension, limited to the kidney. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Exocrine Pancreatic Cancer pT1 TNM Finding

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Exocrine Pancreatic Cancer pT1 TNM Finding
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Exocrine pancreatic cancer with tumor confined to the pancreas and 2 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Exocrine Pancreatic Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Exocrine pancreatic cancer with tumor confined to the pancreas and 2 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Exocrine Pancreatic Cancer pTis TNM Finding

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Exocrine Pancreatic Cancer pTis TNM Finding
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Exocrine pancreatic cancer with a finding of carcinoma in situ, also known as grade III pancreatic intraepithelial neoplasia (PanIn III). (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Exocrine Pancreatic Cancer pTis TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Exocrine pancreatic cancer with a finding of carcinoma in situ, also known as grade III pancreatic intraepithelial neoplasia (PanIn III). (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pT4 - Tumor invades beyond Gerota's Fascia

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Kidney cancer with tumor extending beyond Gerota's fascia. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer with tumor extending beyond Gerota's fascia. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pT3c - Tumor grossly extends into vena cava above diaphragm or invades wall of vena cava

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer pT3c TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer with tumor grossly extending into the vena cava above the diaphragm, or invading the wall of the vena cava. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pT4 - Tumor involves celiac axis or superior mesentric artery
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Exocrine Pancreatic Cancer pT4 TNM Finding

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Exocrine Pancreatic Cancer pT4 TNM Finding
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Exocrine pancreatic cancer extending beyond the pancreas, involving the celiac axis or superior mesenteric artery and therefore unresectable. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Exocrine Pancreatic Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Exocrine pancreatic cancer extending beyond the pancreas, involving the celiac axis or superior mesenteric artery and therefore unresectable. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: Exocrine pancreatic cancer extending beyond the pancreas, but without involvement of the celiac axis or superior mesenteric artery. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Exocrine pancreatic cancer with tumor confined to the pancreas but more than 2 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: Exocrine pancreatic cancer with tumor confined to the pancreas but more than 2 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer in situ in which cancer cells are confined within the glandular basement membrane (intraepithelial). (from CAP Colorectal Cancer Protocol-January 2005 Revision)

PermissibleValues.value: pT3c/d - Tumor invades through muscularis propria into subserosa or nonperitonealized pericolic or perirectal soft tissues - invades greater than 5mm beyond border of muscularis propria

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer with invasion through the muscularis propria into the submucosa, or into non-peritonealized pericolic or perirectal soft tissues, with tumor extension of more than 5 mm beyond the border of the muscularis propria. (from CAP Colorectal Cancer Protocol-January 2005 Revision)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer pT3 c/d TNM Finding
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer with invasion through the muscularis propria into the submucosa, or into non-peritonealized pericolic or perirectal soft tissues, with tumor extension of more than 5 mm beyond the border of the muscularis propria. (from CAP Colorectal Cancer Protocol-January 2005 Revision)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Cancer pT3 a/b TNM Finding

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Cancer pT3 a/b TNM Finding

(from CAP Colorectal Cancer Protocol-January 2005 Revision)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer pT3 a/b TNM Finding
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer with invasion through the muscularis propria into the submucosa, or into non-peritonealized pericolic or perirectal soft tissues, with tumor extension of 5 mm or less beyond the border of the muscularis propria. (from CAP Colorectal Cancer Protocol-January 2005 Revision)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer with invasion through the muscularis propria into the submucosa, or into non-peritonealized pericolic or perirectal soft tissues. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer with invasion into the muscularis propria. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer with invasion into the muscularis propria. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.value: pT1 - Tumor invades submucosa

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer with invasion into the submucosa. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer with invasion into the submucosa. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.value: pTis - Carcinoma in situ - invasion of lamina propria
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Colorectal Cancer pTis Lamina Propria Invasion TNM Finding

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Colorectal Cancer pTis Lamina Propria Invasion TNM Finding
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer in situ involving the lamina propria (intramucosal) without extension through the muscularis mucosa into the submucosa. (from CAP Colorectal Cancer Protocol-January 2005 Revision)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer pTis Lamina Propria Invasion TNM Finding
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer in situ involving the lamina propria (intramucosal) without extension through the muscularis mucosa into the submucosa. (from CAP Colorectal Cancer Protocol-January 2005 Revision)

PermissibleValues.value: pTX - Cannot be assessed or tumor proven by presence of malignant cells in sputum or bronchial washings but not visualized by imaging or bronchoscopy

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed, or in which the diagnosis is confirmed by the presence of malignant cells in sputum or bronchial washings, but not visualized by imaging or bronchoscopy. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pTX TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed, or in which the diagnosis is confirmed by the presence of malignant cells in sputum or bronchial washings, but not visualized by imaging or bronchoscopy. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.value: pT4b - Tumor penetrates the visceral peritoneum

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer which penetrates the visceral peritoneum.

Concepts.longName: Nail Pitting
Concepts.definition: Depressions on the surface of the nail. This finding may be associated with psoriasis.

PermissibleValues.value: pT4a - Tumor directly invades other organs or structures

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer which directly invades other organs or structures.

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer pT4a TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer which directly invades other organs or structures.

PermissibleValues.value: pT4 - Tumor directly invades adjacent structures

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer with direct invasion of adjacent organs or structures and/or perforation of the visceral peritoneum. Direct invasion in T4 includes invasion of other segments of the colorectum by way of the serosa. Invasion of the sigmoid colon by a carcinoma of the cecum, for example, should be classified as T4. Tumor that is adherent to other organs or structures macroscopically is classified as T4. However, if on microscopic examination, no tumor is present in the adhesion, the classification should be pT3. V and L substaging should be used to indicate the presence or absence of vascular or lymphatic invasion. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer with direct invasion of adjacent organs or structures and/or perforation of the visceral peritoneum. Direct invasion in T4 includes invasion of other segments of the colorectum by way of the serosa. Invasion of the sigmoid colon by a carcinoma of the cecum, for example, should be classified as T4. Tumor that is adherent to other organs or structures macroscopically is classified as T4. However, if on microscopic examination, no tumor is present in the adhesion, the classification should be pT3. V and L substaging should be used to indicate the presence or absence of vascular or lymphatic invasion. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pT3 - Tumor of any size that directly invades chest wall/diaphragm/mediastinal/pleura/parietal pericardium/main bronchus (less than 2cm distal to carina without involvement)/associated with atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer directly invading the chest wall (including superior sulcus tumors), diaphragm, mediastinal pleura or parietal pericardium, or a tumor of any size extending into the main bronchus less than 2 cm distal to the carina but without involvement of the carina, or a tumor of any size with atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis involving the entire lung. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer directly invading the chest wall (including superior sulcus tumors), diaphragm, mediastinal pleura or parietal pericardium, or a tumor of any size extending into the main bronchus less than 2 cm distal to the carina but without involvement of the carina, or a tumor of any size with atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis involving the entire lung. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pT2 - Tumor with greater than 3cm in greatest dimension or involves main bronchus or 2cm/more distal to carina or invades visceral pleura or associated with atelectasis/obstructive pneumonitis

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with a tumor size of greater than 3 cm in greatest dimension, or a tumor of any size extending into the main bronchus (2 cm or more distal to the carina), or a tumor of any size invading the visceral pleura, or a tumor with atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis extending to the hilar region without involving the entire lung. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with a tumor size of greater than 3 cm in greatest dimension, or a tumor of any size extending into the main bronchus (2 cm or more distal to the carina), or a tumor of any size invading the visceral pleura, or a tumor with atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis extending to the hilar region without involving the entire lung. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pT1 - Tumor 3cm or less in greatest dimension surrounded by lung or visceral pleura without bronchoscopic evidence of invasion more proximal than lobar bronchus

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with a tumor size of 3 cm or less in greatest dimension, surrounded by lung or visceral pleura and without bronchoscopic evidence of invasion more proximal than the lobar bronchus (not invading the main bronchus). The uncommon superficial tumor of any size with its invasive component limited to the bronchial wall, which may extend proximal to the main bronchus, is also classified as T1. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with a tumor size of 3 cm or less in greatest dimension, surrounded by lung or visceral pleura and without bronchoscopic evidence of invasion more proximal than the lobar bronchus (not invading the main bronchus). The uncommon superficial tumor of any size with its invasive component limited to the bronchial wall, which may extend proximal to the main bronchus, is also classified as T1. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer with tumor 7 cm or less in greatest dimension, limited to the kidney. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.value: pT4 - Tumor of any size that invades mediastinum/heart/great vessels/trachea/esohagus/vertebral body/carina or with separate tumor nodules(s) in same lobe or with mailgnant pleural effusion

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with invasion of the mediastinum, heart, great vessels, trachea, esophagus, vertebral body or carina, or presence of separate tumor nodules within a same lobe, or the presence of a malignant pleural effusion. Although most pleural effusions associated with lung cancer are due to tumor, there are a few patients in whom multiple cytopathologic examinations of the pleural fluid are negative for tumor. In these cases, the fluid is non-bloody and is not an exudate. Such patients may be further evaluated with videothoracoscopy and direct pleural biopsy. When these elements and clinical judgment dictate that the effusion is not related to the tumor, the effusion should be excluded as a staging element. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with invasion of the mediastinum, heart, great vessels, trachea, esophagus, vertebral body or carina, or presence of separate tumor nodules within a same lobe, or the presence of a malignant pleural effusion. Although most pleural effusions associated with lung cancer are due to tumor, there are a few patients in whom multiple cytopathologic examinations of the pleural fluid are negative for tumor. In these cases, the fluid is non-bloody and is not an exudate. Such patients may be further evaluated with videothoracoscopy and direct pleural biopsy. When these elements and clinical judgment dictate that the effusion is not related to the tumor, the effusion should be excluded as a staging element. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual entities required by NCI operations and systems. Includes administrative, financial, organizational and quasi-scientific concepts required for NCI operations and systems.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.longName: Neoplasm Stage
Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
